hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Liquidity Migration Post-BTC Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: After BTC consolidates in a <3% range for 5 consecutive days while total crypto market cap increases, the next BTC breakout >2% will trigger disproportionate liquidity migration to top 10 altcoins (excluding ETH) with 2:1 beta for 24-48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consolidation builds pent-up liquidity that seeks higher returns. When BTC finally breaks out, sidelined capital rotates to alts for amplified exposure, especially when altcoin funding isn't overheated.
entry_conditions: BTC trades in <3% range for 5 consecutive days
Total crypto market cap shows net increase over those 5 days
BTC breaks out >2% from consolidation range
Aggregated altcoin funding rates remain neutral to slightly negative

exit_conditions.take_profit: Selected altcoin achieves 2x the BTC move percentage
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC retraces back into consolidation range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTC breakouts that fail to generate altcoin outperformance despite favorable conditions
